items.description: River Hogsmill area from Ewell to Kingston upon Thames
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Kingston upon Thames, Surrey

items.message:
River levels have risen as a result of heavy and persistent rainfall this morning.  Flooding of roads and low lying land is expected from 12:30 today, 07 August 2021. We expect flooding to affect low lying land, gardens, and roads close to local watercourses.
Further showery rainfall is forecast through this afternoon.  However we expect river levels to begin falling by 14:00 this afternoon.

Our incident response staff are actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required.

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 17:00 this afternoon, 07 August 2021, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Wey in the Passfield mill area as a result of heavy rainfall. 
River levels have peaked and will remain steady, with no further rise forecasted.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed and trash screens and in the area checking defences. 
The weather will remain showery.
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 08/08/21, or as the situation changes.
